_comment2: The size in MB after which the spawn file gets renamed and a new one is used, set to 0 to disable.
_comment3: Standard scan range, represented as layers around the center hexagon.
_comment4: How often it will scan. Can be higher under bad server conditions.
_comment6: Pokemon with these ids won't be shown in the map. (data still gets collected)
_comment7: Will scale icons by this factor.
_comment8: Will scale the whole user interface by this factor.
_comment9: The html page will only try to load the live data for ids listed here.
_comment10: The path to the res folder from the html point of view.
_comment11: Pushbullet settings. You need a Pushbullet API key for it. Can input multiple API keys, comma separated. Put ids of pokemon you want to be notified about into push_ids.
_comment12: The number of times it will scan until it quits. Put it to 0 for infinite scans, 1 for just a single one.
_comment13: true = Simultaneous login of all accounts, false = Subsequent login of all accounts, setting only for the beginning of the scan.
_comment14: The profiles. Each with their own id, login info, and coordinates.
